column4: Hi can someone help me, I just get Ubuntu Server working and I need help setting things up.
Sorry.  Can someone help me set up my Ubuntu Server to support a website?
so -- just a simple Apache installation?
or something fancier?
this is the tutorial (of sorts) that i've been following http://howtoforge.com/perfect-server-ubuntu-8.10-p4http://howtoforge.com/perfect-server-ubuntu-8.10-p4
this is the tutorial (of sorts) that i've been following http://howtoforge.com/perfect-server-ubuntu-8.10-p4
OK -- where are you having trouble with it?
...well, depending on what kind of connectivity you have, IP allocation and DNS setup may be out of your hands.
how can i tell you what connectivity I have
I'm not running wireless and connected through ethernet.  Does that help?

the config file controlling your server's local IP address is /etc/network/interfaces, but any static IP you set in there needs to be valid for the network you're on, and not be something the local DHCP server might hand to someone else.
who's your local network administrator?
I don't know.
where do you get your Internet service from?
Can I tell you my IP address?
...well, you *can*, and I can do a traceback to see who your provider is, but that's not really enough information. Are you plugged into a corporate network, or a home network?
home network
that being the case, you can log into your router and configure the IP range used for DHCP (and, thus, which IPs *aren't*)
Would you mind walking me though?
...so, pick one of the IPs that aren't in the DHCP range, and set it up in /etc/network/interfaces (see the output from "man interfaces" for documentation on that file)
I can't help you with your router -- that's well beyond the scope of supporting Ubuntu, and there are too many different models for me to know them all.
Can you explain more in depth
see my PM.
